If you're in a house, magicians from other houses will challenge you to battles.  Each house has a different philosophy.  You can also do online battles in chat rooms.

column3: How do I battle against another magician?
column4: You and the other magician will try to cast a spell, the first one to succeed wins the round.  Each round you win is a step toward the four steps victory.
There are four steps to win a battle: use a stripping spell, animate a restraint, tighten it and use a gag spell.

column3: Why not use a gag spell right away?
column4: Your adversary will counter the gag spell easily if she's not properly restrained.
(She nods.)  Each step that's affecting you will make it harder for you to cast a spell.  (The blue square will be bigger, making it easier to fail.)

column3: Chain spells are harder than rope?
column4: Correct, chain spells are harder to cast than rope spells, but being chained will make it more difficult for a magician to cast new spells.
(She nods.)  Is there anything else I can help you with?
In House Maiestas, they focus on domination, submission and magic to control the mind.  They have a huge hierarchy with strict rules and etiquette that they follow by the book.
House Vincula is all about bondage magic.  The tighter the better.  They use spells to make evasion impossible or create devious traps.  Be careful if you're outnumbered.
The caring House Amplector focuses on charms, enchantments and love magic.  You will see them hug and cuddle all the time.  They greatly help and care about each other.
House Corporis believes that true magic comes from the physical realm.  They use magic to inflict or endure pain, trigger arousal or orgasms.  They don't play soft.
House Maiestas and House Vincula are in a constant magic war.  And there's no truce in sight between House Amplector and House Corporis.
